Detailed Description

This class encapsulates all the stages related to the optical character recognition process of every clip within a newspaper's page. For each image provided representing a press clip, you can obtain its text and a number of statistics regarding the recognition process.

See also:
Dataset, Text, Statistics, Clip
Warning:
The Dataset object passed in constructor will destroyed when the Recognizer object is destroyed.

Member Function Documentation

void Recognizer::extractText ( const Clip &  pressClip,
const ClassificationParadigm &  paradigm 
)

Parameters:
pressClip Press clip to be processed.
paradigm Paradigm that must be used to classify the patterns found in the press clip.
Postcondition:
The internal members are set so that recognized text is available through Text::text() method.
This method executes the recognition process in four stages: preprocessing, feature extraction, classification and postprocessing.

As the first important step, image and data preprocessing serve the purpose of extracting regions of interest, enhancing and cleaning up the images, so that they can be directly and efficiently processed by the feature extraction stage.

const Text & Recognizer::text (  )  const [inline]

Returns:
A Text object with data about the recognized text.
